38-year-old.context: Chris is a very nice 38-year-old male with nasal septal deviation and bilateral inferior turbinate hypertrophy causing nasal obstruction.

nasal septal deviation.context: The patient was placed on the operating room table in the supine position. After adequate general endotracheal anesthesia was administered, the right and left nasal septal mucosa and right and left inferior turbinates were anesthetized with 1% lidocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine using approximately 10 mL.

bilateral inferior turbinate hypertrophy.context: The patient was placed on the operating room table in the supine position. After adequate general endotracheal anesthesia was administered, the right and left nasal septal mucosa and right and left inferior turbinates were anesthetized with 1% lidocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine using approximately 10 mL.

tonsillitis.context: The patient was placed on the operating room table in the supine position. After adequate general endotracheal anesthesia was administered, the right and left nasal septal mucosa and right and left inferior turbinates were anesthetized with 1% lidocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine using approximately 10 mL.

hypertrophy.context: The patient was placed on the operating room table in the supine position. After adequate general endotracheal anesthesia was administered, the right and left nasal septal mucosa and right and left inferior turbinates were anesthetized with 1% lidocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine using approximately 10 mL.

edema to the uvula and soft palate.context: The patient was extubated in the operating room, brought to the recovery room in satisfactory condition. There were no intraoperative complications.

nasal septoplasty.context: Operation Performed: 1. Nasal septoplasty. 2. Bilateral submucous resection of the inferior turbinates. 3. Tonsillectomy and resection of soft palate.

bilateral submucous resection of the inf.context: Operation Performed: 1. Nasal septoplasty. 2. Bilateral submucous resection of the inferior turbinates. 3. Tonsillectomy and resection of soft palate.

tonsillectomy and resection of soft pala.context: Operation Performed: 1. Nasal septoplasty. 2. Bilateral submucous resection of the inferior turbinates. 3. Tonsillectomy and resection of soft palate.

tonsillitis with hypertrophy.context: The patient was extubated in the operating room, brought to the recovery room in satisfactory condition. There were no intraoperative complications.

nasal septal deviation with bilateral in.context: The patient was extubated in the operating room, brought to the recovery room in satisfactory condition. There were no intraoperative complications.

hemostasis.context: Hemostasis was acquired by using suction electrocautery.

tonsillectomy.context: The left tonsil was grasped with a curved Allis forceps, retracted medially, and the anterior tonsillar pillar was incised with Bovie electrocautery.

resection of soft palate.context: The extremely edematous portion of soft palate was resected using a right angle clamp and right angle scissor and was closed with 3-0 Vicryl in a figure-of-eight interrupted fashion.
